name: Tom Yum Goong
description: A quintessential Thai soup known for its hot and sour flavors, made with fresh shrimp, lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, and chili.

name: Pad Thai
description: Stir-fried rice noodles tossed with tofu, bean sprouts, egg, and crushed peanuts, flavored with tamarind paste and fish sauce.

name: Som Tum
description: A spicy green papaya salad combining shredded papaya, tomatoes, green beans, peanuts, and a tangy lime dressing.

name: Massaman Curry
description: A mild, rich curry with beef or chicken, potatoes, onions, and peanuts in a coconut milk base, flavored with cinnamon and cardamom.

name: Khao Soi
description: A creamy northern Thai curry noodle soup topped with crispy fried noodles, pickled mustard greens, and lime.

name: Pad Krapow Moo Saap
description: A spicy stir-fry of minced pork with holy basil, garlic, and chilies, served over rice and often topped with a fried egg.

name: Gaeng Daeng
description: A fragrant red curry made with meat, coconut milk, red curry paste, and kaffir lime leaves.

name: Pad See Ew
description: Stir-fried flat rice noodles with soy sauce, Chinese broccoli, and your choice of meat or tofu.

name: Kai Med Ma Muang
description: Stir-fried chicken with cashew nuts, onions, bell peppers, and dried chilies in a savory sauce.

name: Yam Nua
description: A spicy Thai beef salad with grilled beef, onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, and herbs in a tangy lime dressing.

name: Gai Yang
description: Grilled marinated chicken, often served with sticky rice and a spicy dipping sauce. A favorite street food in Thailand.

name: Laab
description: A northeastern Thai minced meat salad, typically made with pork or chicken, mixed with herbs, lime juice, and toasted rice powder.

name: Moo Ping
description: Grilled pork skewers marinated in garlic, soy sauce, and spices, commonly enjoyed as a quick street snack.

name: Khao Pad
description: A simple yet flavorful Thai fried rice dish, often prepared with shrimp, chicken, or vegetables and served with lime and cucumber slices.

name: Tom Kha Gai
description: A creamy and aromatic chicken soup made with coconut milk, galangal, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and mushrooms.

name: Gaeng Keow Wan
description: Green curry made with coconut milk, green curry paste, Thai eggplant, and meat or tofu. It's mildly spicy and incredibly fragrant.

name: Kanom Jeen
description: Soft rice noodles served with a variety of curries and fresh herbs. Popular options include green curry and fish-based sauces.

name: Pla Kapong Neung Manao
description: Steamed whole sea bass with a tangy lime, garlic, and chili dressing, served with fresh herbs and rice.

name: Hor Mok
description: A steamed curry custard made with fish, coconut milk, and spices, traditionally served in banana leaf cups.

name: Sai Oua
description: Northern Thai sausage packed with bold flavors from lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, garlic, and chilies.

name: Khao Niao Mamuang
description: A beloved Thai dessert made with sweet sticky rice, fresh mango slices, and coconut milk.

name: Nam Prik Kapi
description: A pungent shrimp paste chili dip served with fresh and steamed vegetables or fried fish.

name: Tod Mun Pla
description: Fried fish cakes made with red curry paste, kaffir lime leaves, and green beans, served with sweet chili sauce.

name: Gaeng Hung Lay
description: A northern Thai curry featuring tender pork belly, garlic, ginger, and a blend of aromatic spices.

name: Khanom Buang
description: A crispy Thai crepe filled with meringue and sweet or savory toppings like shredded coconut or minced shrimp.

name: Kuay Teow Reua
description: Known as 'boat noodles,' this rich and flavorful soup features pork or beef, noodles, and aromatic spices.

name: Yam Pla Dook Foo
description: Crispy catfish flakes served with a tangy green mango salad and a sweet-and-sour dressing.

name: Gaeng Pa
description: A spicy 'jungle curry' without coconut milk, featuring wild herbs, vegetables, and your choice of meat.

name: Pla Pao
description: Salt-crusted whole fish grilled over charcoal and stuffed with lemongrass, served with spicy dipping sauce.

name: Khanom Tom
description: A traditional Thai dessert made of boiled rice flour balls filled with palm sugar and coated with shredded coconut.
